intro: Mimulus cupriphilus, commonly known as copperleaf monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking copper-colored leaves and bright orange to red flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in streamside habitats. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is known for its ability to tolerate heavy metals in the soil. Mimulus cupriphilus plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
